page.title: 12FARMING IN HARNHILL
page.content: Mr. Robert Henly farms at Harnhill and his land extends into nearby Driffield. His father, Abraham Henly, bought the farm in 1918, and his family came to live in the Manor House in 1923. Before then, they lived at Barton Farm, Siddington. During the second World War, the Henlys responded to the call for self-sufficiency in Britain's food supplies by increasing the arable acreage to 650 and greatly reducing the permanent pasture and the size of the beef and sheep enterprises . For 45 years, from 1939 to the present time, Harnhill has continued to concentrate on cereals as its main farm product. They occupy three quarters of the area; the remaining quarter provides forage for a flock of 750 ewes for fat-lamb production. (continued on page 13)
